text.text_translated:
Wasfia Nazreen was a young girl.
She saw a child from another country.
The child was playing with a hula hoop.
This was in Bangladesh, Wasfia's country.
Wasfia wanted to play with it.
But she did not.
Girls in her country should not play with hula hoops.
They should not ride bikes.
So Wasfia only watched.

Now, Wasfia is a woman.
She climbed the Seven Summits.
These are the seven highest mountains in the world.
Everest and Kilimanjaro are two of them.
Not many people in the world did this.
She was the first person to hula-hoop on each mountain top.
She did this for women and girls.
In her country, people do not want girls to do sport.
She wanted to give them power to do sport.
She wanted to help them feel strong.

feedback.feedback: FAIL: Meaning Preservation Failure. The MeaningBERT score of 0.6284 is significantly below the required 0.75. The core meaning and nuance of the original text have been lost or altered. Specifically, the original text states 'Wasfia reluctantly stood by and watched'. The word 'reluctantly' conveys a crucial emotional state of resistance or sadness regarding her inability to participate due to societal beliefs. Your version, 'Wasfia wanted to play with it. But she did not. So Wasfia only watched,' shifts the emphasis from her reluctance to merely observe to an inferred desire to play and subsequent inaction. This rephrasing loses the specific emotional depth and the internal conflict implied by 'reluctantly'. The output describes actions but fails to capture the original's subtle yet important emotional context. Suggestion: Rephrase the section to accurately convey Wasfia's reluctance to simply watch, rather than inferring a desire to play.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Wasfia Nazreen was a young girl. She saw a child from a foreign country. The child was playing with a hula hoop. This was in Bangladesh, Wasfia's country. Wasfia watched. She could not play. In her country, people believed girls should not play with hula hoops. They also believed girls should not ride bikes.

Now, Wasfia is a woman. She climbed the Seven Summits. These are the seven highest mountains in the world. Everest and Kilimanjaro are two of them. Not many people in the world did this. She was the first person to hula-hoop on each mountain top. She did this to give power to women and girls. In her country, people tell girls not to do sport.
